resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

jianxind commented on pull request #6650: ARROW-8141: [C++] speed unpack1_32 using intrinsics API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6650
 
 
   BM_PlainDecodingBoolean benchmark shows about 1.3x to 1.7x improvements per the size
   against the avx512 complier optimizations.
   
   Signed-off-by: Frank Du <frank.du@intel.com>

jianxind commented on issue #6650: ARROW-8141: [C++] speed unpack1_32 using intrinsics API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6650#issuecomment-600406355
 
 
   We are running benchmark on the arrow avx512 build, perf show unpack1_32 as the major hotspot for BM_PlainDecodingBoolean indicator.
   
   Implement this func with Intrinsics code show big improvements. See below the results on CLX 8280 cpu which is capable of AVX512.
   
   
   Indictor | default sse   build | avx512 build | avx512 build +   Intrinsics | Intrinsics   improvements
   -- | -- | -- | -- | --
   BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/1024(G/s) | 1.55394 | 3.77701 | 5.02805 | 1.331224964
   BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/4096(G/s) | 1.83472 | 5.3826 | 8.3443 | 1.550235945
   BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/32768(G/s) | 2.00957 | 6.1258 | 10.3793 | 1.694358288
   BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/65536(G/s) | 2.02249 | 6.20035 | 10.5778 | 1.706000468
   
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #6650: ARROW-8141: [C++] speed unpack1_32 using intrinsics API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6650#issuecomment-600540728
 
 
   I'll say that I personally would rather not want ourselves to spend time on AVX512 intrinsics while there are so few CPUs around supporting AVX512. IMHO, it would be much more useful for the Arrow userbase to optimize using SSE or AVX/AVX2 intrinsics.
   
   About the PR, it's obvious that the file you're touching was initially generated by a script. Unfortunately the script doesn't seem part of the codebase, so we'll need to recreate it somehow and make any changes in the script itself.
   
   cc @wesm
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jianxind commented on issue #6650: ARROW-8141: [C++] speed unpack1_32 using intrinsics API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6650#issuecomment-600566157
 
 
   > I'll say that I personally would rather not want ourselves to spend time on AVX512 intrinsics while there are so few CPUs around supporting AVX512. IMHO, it would be much more useful for the Arrow userbase to optimize using SSE or AVX/AVX2 intrinsics.
   
   For client, yes small ratio of cpus has AVX512. But for server, actually all Intel Xeon Scalable processors family support AVX512 feature, currently most server of cloud service providers are based on Xeon Scalable. Others ISV like tensor-flow, pytorch, numpy are heavily optimized to utilize AVX512 performance. 
   
   I don't know too much about what's the most usage for arrow, but if many of them are cloud based, AVX512 definitely can improve the performance significantly. For this case, AVX2 or SSE lack rich set of SIMD instructions which AVX512 provide, I tried to implement with same ways for SSE, but conclude it can't beat the comelier.
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

   > I'll say that I personally would rather not want ourselves to spend time on AVX512 intrinsics while there are so few CPUs around supporting AVX512. IMHO, it would be much more useful for the Arrow userbase to optimize using SSE or AVX/AVX2 intrinsics.
   
   For client, yes small ratio of cpus has AVX512. But for server, actually all Intel Xeon Scalable processors family support AVX512 feature, currently most server of cloud service providers are based on Xeon Scalable. Others ISV like tensor-flow, pytorch, numpy are heavily optimized to utilize AVX512 performance. 
   
   I don't know too much about what's the most usage for arrow, but if many of them are cloud based, AVX512 definitely can improve the performance significantly. For this case, AVX2 or SSE lack rich set of SIMD instructions which AVX512 provide, I tried to implement with same ways for SSE, but conclude it can't beat the compiler.

jianxind commented on issue #6650: ARROW-8141: [C++] speed unpack1_32 using intrinsics API
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6650#issuecomment-600934589
 
 
   > The scripts used to generate the file originally are contained in
   > 
   > https://github.com/lemire/FrameOfReference
   > 
   > +1 -- merging this. let us open a follow-up JIRA about managing AVX-optimized functions from this file?
   
   Thanks wesm. I find the script file, https://github.com/lemire/FrameOfReference/blob/master/scripts/turbopacking32.py and will check if there's a way to leverage similar script for AVX-optimized.
   
   Sure for our team(intel) will continue looking the AVX521 build sanity and performance as the amazing adopting curve in the ecosystem. We has some scripts(https://github.com/clearlinux/clr-avx-tools/blob/master/avxjudge.pys) to evaluate the SIMD score for library/package and Arrow has a amazing high sse score thus it appears AVX512 probably boost the performance a lot. 
   
   For the CI, yes we has some AVX capable servers in the lab, I has to check with policy if it can be used for such outside usage, will reach back later. But at least we can easily maintain an auto task locally monitoring the healthy of AVX512 build per a weekly bias.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
We are running benchmark on the arrow avx512 build, perf show unpack1_32 as the major hotspot for BM_PlainDecodingBoolean indicator.

Implement this func with Intrinsics code show big improvements. See below the results on CLX 8280 cpu which is capable of AVX512.
|Indictor|default sse build|avx512 build|avx512 build + Intrinsics|Intrinsics improvements|
|BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/1024(G/s)|1.55394|3.77701|5.02805|1.331224964|
|BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/4096(G/s)|1.83472|5.3826|8.3443|1.550235945|
|BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/32768(G/s)|2.00957|6.1258|10.3793|1.694358288|
|BM_PlainDecodingBoolean/65536(G/s)|2.02249|6.20035|10.5778|1.706000468|
fields.summary: [C++] Optimize BM_PlainDecodingBoolean performance using AVX512 Intrinsics API

comments.body: [~frank.du] please leave completed issues in Resolved state
